name: Skillet Pork Chops with Creamy Mushroom Sauce and Roasted Green Beans
description: Pan-seared pork chops topped with a quick creamy mushroom-garlic sauce, served alongside oven-roasted green beans. Mild, familiar flavors for a fast family dinner.
prep_steps: Trim ends from green beans and pat dry.
Finely chop onions and mince garlic.
Pat pork chops dry; season both sides with salt and pepper.
cook_steps: Roast green beans: Toss green beans with 1 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt and pepper on a baking tray. Roast 12–15 minutes until tender-crisp, shaking once.

Sear pork: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Sear pork chops 3–4 minutes per side until browned and just cooked through (internal 63°C/145°F). Transfer to a warm plate; tent loosely.
Start sauce aromatics: Reduce heat to medium. Add 1 tbsp butter to the same skillet. Add onions and cook 2 minutes until softened. Add garlic; cook 30 seconds.
Cook mushrooms: Add mushrooms and a pinch of salt. Cook 4–5 minutes, stirring, until browned and their liquid evaporates.
Finish sauce: Stir in 150 ml cream; simmer 2–3 minutes to thicken slightly. Add any pork resting juices. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in half the parsley.

Serve: Return pork to the skillet to coat with sauce for 1 minute. Plate pork with mushroom sauce on top. Add roasted green beans alongside and sprinkle remaining parsley. Optional: squeeze lemon over green beans.
